TextBlock._LCLZText: Create a 3D PCB document from the selected sketch or face.
Use the 3D PCB document as an external reference in the enclosure design.
Define the shape of the PCB via a sketched profile.
Select a profile and an origin point.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a profile and an origin point.

Description._LCLZText: After selecting the profile, you must choose an origin to ensure the communication with EAGLE is precise. One corner of the PCB normally works well. Decide if the profile is on the top or bottom of the PCB, and be sure that the extrusion direction is correct. The PCB shape will become visible to EAGLE after the model is saved, and the EAGLE user can change the shape of the board as well.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Check the status of the PCB shape and component positions.
Both the board shape and the component positions can be driven by either Fusion or EAGLE. Use this command to understand the state of the model.

Tips._LCLZText: Both the board shape and the component positions can be driven by either Fusion or EAGLE. Use this command to understand the state of the model.

Description._LCLZText: If the board shape and/or component positions have been edited in Fusion after the last EAGLE update, this command will allow you to see both PCB shapes. Also, it will tell you if your current component positions are different from the last EAGLE update.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Move PCB components to new locations on the board.
Select a component and move it by dragging or typing in values.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a component and move it by dragging or typing in values.

Description._LCLZText: Note that no Move feature will be created in the timeline. However, the new locations will be remembered by Fusion, and will become visible to EAGLE after the model is saved, and the EAGLE user can move the components as well.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Copies the profile supplied from EAGLE to an upstream Fusion sketch.

Tips._LCLZText: Copies the profile supplied from EAGLE to an upstream Fusion sketch. You can copy to a pre-existing sketch, or create a new sketch by selecting a planar face or construction plane. The selected sketch or plane must be parallel to the PCB. If there is already an upstream sketch that drives the PCB feature, that sketch will be selected by default.

Description._LCLZText: This command is primarily useful when both the Fusion and EAGLE user are actively changing the shape of the PCB.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Replace PCB component with different one.
Select a PCB 3d model(step, stp file format) to replace existing PCB component.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a model to replace selected PCB component and move it to adjust its position.

Description._LCLZText: Note that no Move feature will be created in the timeline. However, the PCB component will be replace with new model, the change will not able to get back to eagle.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Download PCB component from library to replace existing PCB component.

Tips._LCLZText: Download PCB component from library to replace the selected PCB component and move it to adjust its position.

Description._LCLZText: Note that no Move feature will be created in the timeline. However, the PCB component will be replace with new model, the change will not able to get back to eagle.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Move PCB component body to align with the footprint on the board.
Select a body from PCB component and move it by dragging or typing in values.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a body from PCB component and move it by dragging or typing in values.

Description._LCLZText: Note that no Move feature will be created in the timeline. However, the new locations will be remembered by Fusion.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Edit the sketch generated from EAGLE board.

Title._LCLZText: Edit the sketch generated from EAGLE board

Tips._LCLZText: This command will activate the sketch generated from EAGLE board for editing.

Description._LCLZText: This command is only available when there's sketch generated from EAGLE board.
